column4: Hi ! I get a strange error "Can't connect to http::80 (Bad hostname 'http:')" with apt-cacher. I checked /etc/apt/sources.list which seems correct. Any idea ?
paste your sources, sounds like you've got something funky going on
one of the problematic line : deb http://localhost:3142/security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu dapper-security main restricted universe multiverse
yeah, that should be http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu dapper etc etc
let me check ... funny, it did work without the proxy ...

still the same problem ... what I dont understand is why it looks for a "http:" hostname. And the logs give me : "getting http://http://localhost:3142/security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/dapper/multiverse/binary-i386/Packages.gz"
paste your whole sources.list
in which channel ? Here ?
ok, sent under the name gehel
got a url?
sorry : http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/18757
no problem
hmm, looks alright.  I imagine it's some problem with your proxy then.  Can you go to http://localhost:3142/au.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ in a browser, and get there without two https?
most interesting, if I get " http://localhost:3142/security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/dapper-security/multiverse/binary-i386/Packages.gz" in my browser, I get the file ...
that is odd.  You might've found a bug.  Do you get the double thing with just the directory listing? it might have to do with trailing slashes
I'd check launchpad to see if someone has filed the bug already, either with apt itself, or the proxy program youre using.
apt-cacher doest allow directory listing. It gives "Sorry, not allowed to fetch that type of file:"
right, I'm talking about in a webbrowser
yep, from a browser, I try to access apt-cacher (my proxy) which refuses to give directory listings
ah, I see.  I'd check launchpad for bugs with apt-cacher
thanks for your help ! I'll get back if I find something interesting ...
